required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Testing A Pregnancy Decision Making Tool for Women With Spinal Cord Injury (SCI)
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Testing A Pregnancy Decision Making Tool for Women With Spinal Cord Injury

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this project is to pilot test a decision-making tool that is tailored for women with SCI to support them in the decision-making process. Pilot testing focuses on feasibility and preliminary efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the readiness to make a choice in Stage of Decision-Making Scale
primary_outcome.description: Decision or choice predisposition about pregnancy. The single-item scale ranges from "haven't begun to think about choices" to "have already made a decision and unlikely to change my mind".

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Decisional Conflict Scale Score
primary_outcome.description: Decisional conflict is characterized by uncertainty about a decision. The Decisional Conflict Scale consists of 9 items with 5 response options. Total scores range from 0 (no decisional conflict) to 45 (extremely high decisional conflict).

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of decision making tool as assessed by participant rating of the presentation of information
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability of decision making tool is measured by 11 items that measure the presentation of information are rated on Likert scales ranging from 1 (poor) to 4 (excellent) with higher scores reflecting better information presentation

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of decision making tool as assessed by participant rating by the usefulness in supporting decision making
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability is measured by 9 items. The items measure the usefulness of worksheets in the decision making tool and are rated on Likert scales ranging from 1 (not at all useful) to 5 (very useful). Higher scores indicate an increase in usefulness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Demand of decision making tool as assessed by duration of intervention use
secondary_outcome.description: Tracking usage through web statistics (i.e. site traffic and length of stay on the webpage)

secondary_outcome.measure: Demand of decision making tool as measured by question on likeliness of using the tool after the study is over
secondary_outcome.description: This is measured with a single item rated on Likert scales of 1 (definitely not likely) to 5 (very likely). Higher scores indicate a higher likelihood of using the tool after the study is over.

secondary_outcome.measure: Implementation of decision making tool as measured by question of ease of use of tool
secondary_outcome.description: Implementation is measured with a single item rated on Likert scales ranging from 1 (very hard) to 5 (very easy).

arm_group.description: Women will receive the decision making tool and use for a 3 month period.

intervention.description: Participants will be directed to use the decision tool for 3 months using it at their own pace. The tool covers topics relevant to women with disabilities in considering or planning a pregnancy and reflects core elements of decision making tools based on the Ottawa Framework for Decision Support.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Spinal cord injury (traumatic or non-traumatic)
- Need for assistance with daily life activities and/or personal care; women with mild, moderate or severe severity will be eligible
- actively planning or in the process of making a decision about whether or not to get pregnant in the near future
Exclusion Criteria:
- No plans for getting pregnant

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Chair, Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and Associate Professor of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation
